image.altText: A woman and man hold each other surrounded by a crowd.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has avoided convictions and a jail sentence, seven years after publicly exposing aggressive debt collection practices at the tax office.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle spared convictions, jail sentence

image.altText: A man sits on a couch, looking to the side with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Seven years ago Richard Boyle's home was raided after he spoke out about heavy-handed debt collection tactics at the Australian Taxation Office. Now the whistleblower's case has finally closed, as he walks from court with a one-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: ATO whistleblower's 'suffered' for years since AFP raids

image.altText: Close up of Troy Bell's face looking serious outdoors

props.synopsis: Troy Bell has announced he will step down as the Mount Gambier MP after the Supreme Court dismissed his appeal against a jury's verdict which previously found him guilty of theft and fraud charges.

title.children: SA MP Troy Bell steps down after losing court appeal

image.altText: A screenshot of a woman inside a clinic with a graphic behind her 'Building a bigger health system'

props.synopsis: South Australians are seeing more advertising on their screens promoting the state government's infrastructure projects and health spending, prompting questions over the line between political and government advertising.

title.children: SA government accused of 'spruiking' its agenda in taxpayer-funded ads

image.altText: A group of people in orange uniforms cheering around a small flat vehicle with solar panels on top

props.synopsis: Dutch team Brunel has been crowned the winners of the 2025 World Solar Challenge after a five-day marathon race across the Australian outback.

title.children: Dutch team 'back from the ashes' of 2019 fire to win World Solar Challenge

image.altText: Four Giant Australian cuttlefish are seen close up at a low angle under water. they are purple and grey in colour.

props.synopsis: A highly experimental, nearly $700,000 "bubble curtain" will be installed next week hoping to protect cuttlefish and their eggs in the Upper Spencer Gulf from South Australia's toxic algal bloom.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' to protect giant Australian cuttlefish from algal bloom

image.altText: A woman and man standing next to each other in front of a bar laughing.

props.synopsis: Trevor Barry had no idea his discoveries would lead him to scientific publications and international recognition when he built his own observatory in his outback backyard.

title.children: Book explores 'ordinary' miner's evolution to outback astronomer

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says it will appoint administrators to run the remote APY Lands in the state's Far North amid concerns over governance.

title.children: SA government to appoint administrators to run APY Lands

image.altText: A diver holding a tape measure next to a rocky structure in a lake

props.synopsis: One of Australia's best-known divers, Richard Harris, was among those given a rare glimpse below Mount Gambier's major water source and tourist attraction.

title.children: Divers given rare chance to plunge below surface of mysterious lake

image.altText: A teenage boys with glasses puts on a face mask out in a garden

props.synopsis: Five months after the algal bloom was first detected on the Fleurieu Peninsula, residents along parts of the SA coast say it is continuing to impact their physical and mental health, with a new survey revealing feelings of worry and anxiety.

title.children: SA coast residents struck by long-lasting cough, itchy eyes as algal bloom persists

image.altText: An image of the Big Four Australian banks ATMs side by side

props.synopsis: A 32-year-old Broken Hill man is arrested after more than $700,000 in cash is unaccounted-for from ATMs in the area. Police allege he accessed a portion of the money through his employment.

title.children: More than $700k in cash missing from multiple Broken Hill ATMs

image.altText: A man sits at a table with paper and a glass jug in front of cabinets and a mirror on the wall

props.synopsis: A South Australian ENGIE customer says he was slapped with a $1,200 electricity bill for a single month last year. It follows the company issuing price "corrections" to 3,000 South Australian ENGIE customers.

title.children: Customer slapped with $1,200 energy bill for one month wants better protection

image.altText: Three women wearing black standing looking serious at the reception of a doctors clinic.

props.synopsis: Clinics say the GP shortage is triggering people to abuse staff at South Australia's second largest city, while some patients travel 50 kilometres to smaller towns for urgent care.

title.children: Frustrations boil over as no GPs accept new patients in major city

image.altText: vv_katter

props.synopsis: Federal MP Bob Katter was angered by a question relating to his Lebanese heritage on Thursday morning and accused the journalist of being a "racist".

title.children: Robbie Katter defends his father's actions towards journalist

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing sunglasses and a grey suit standing in front of a house door waving with an open hand.

props.synopsis: Iran's ambassador to Australia, Ahmad Sadeghi, described the allegations against his country as "baseless" before boarding a flight out of the country. Take a look back at the day's coverage below.

title.children: Iran's ambassador makes first public comments since expulsion — as it happened

image.altText: Woman on a soccer field with her hands on her hips.

props.synopsis: Transgender soccer player Rliey Dennis has won a court case over vilification against her that went international. Speaking exclusively to 7.30 she has detailed her trauma.

title.children: Transgender soccer player speaks out after vilification went international

image.altText: Luke Sommerton of the Panthers is attended to by a trainer, walking off the field

props.synopsis: The Canterbury Bulldogs can secure a top four finish on the NRL ladder and earn a double-chance in the finals with a victory over the Penrith Panthers. Follow live.

title.children: Bulldogs in control as inexperienced Panthers suffer injury woes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 57' NO TRY: Bunker overturns Panthers try
58' TRY: Panthers score their first try

image.altText: A close-up side profile of a man with thick brown hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: After a trial that "captured the imagination" of the world's media and "must have cost millions", the case against Matt Wright boils down to nothing more than "guesswork and speculation", a court has heard.

title.children: Jury retires after defence says there are 'no winners' in Matt Wright case

image.altText: Jeff Fox, smiling, holds up medals in a green and gold Australia jacket.

props.synopsis: Australia's three-time Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox says she has been left with some "gnarly scars" and some added toughness after undergoing successful surgery.

title.children: Jess Fox sidelined after 'whirlwind' surgery to remove kidney tumour

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson in front of a Qantas plane

props.synopsis: Qantas reports a 28 per cent rise in net profit as boss Vanessa Hudson says the company will "learn from" the fallout of its unlawful outsourcing of ground handling, which resulted in a $90 million fine and $120 million in compensation.

title.children: $90 million penalty 'absolutely not' cost of doing business, Qantas boss says

image.altText: A skier in the distance on a snowy mountain

props.synopsis: Victoria's alpine region braces for one of the season's most significant snowfalls, amid the ongoing search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman.

title.children: Snow enthusiasts told to stay away as Porepunkah manhunt continues

image.altText: Marles and Vance in black suit, red tie, Hegseth in blue suit, tie, all smiling, stand in front of Australia, US flags, table.

props.synopsis: Earlier, the Pentagon had said the pair had a "happenstance encounter", not a meeting, but it now says the meeting was scheduled in advance.

title.children: Pentagon walks back denial of Marles-Hegseth meeting

image.altText: female journalist stands in front of middle eastern city

props.synopsis: The ABC has not had a China correspondent based permanently in Beijing since 2020.

title.children: ABC to have China correspondent for first time in five years

image.altText: hero

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found organisers linked to the March for Australia protests sharing white supremacy posts on social media and, in one case, pro-Nazi and pro-Hitler memes.

title.children: 'Protect white heritage': Anti-immigration march 'messaging' revealed

image.altText: The picture of a girl wearing a red school blazer and glasses

props.synopsis: Year 7 student Milla Killeen was killed and more than 20 children taken to hospital when the Christian College Geelong bus rolled near Geelong on Wednesday morning. Her family has issued a statement saying she had the 'whole world in front of her'.

title.children: Family describes victim of school bus rollover as 'a beautiful soul'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for expelling the Iranian ambassador and listing the IRGC as a terrorist organisation, but no end to the political brawl over antisemitic attacks in Australia.

title.children: The government takes swift action on Iran but the Coalition maintains the rage

image.altText: BRUCE LEHRMANN COURT

props.synopsis: Mr Lehrmann's lawyer has applied to see messages between the complainant and a lawyer who acted for Network Ten in a defamation case brought by the former Liberal Party staffer against the network.

title.children: Lehrmann's defence applies for messages allegedly sent to rape complainant by Network Ten lawyer

image.altText: An image of a potato cut in half with rust coloured arcs inside on its flesh.

props.synopsis: Biosecurity Tasmania says the virus has been detected at a further four Tasmanian properties, and may have been present in the state for two years.

title.children: Potato mop-top virus detected at four more Tasmanian sites

image.altText: Mitch Brown speaking to the Daily Aus.

props.synopsis: Openly gay male athletes are rare in mainstream Australian sport, but some have built up the courage to share their story.

title.children: Mitch Brown a rare example of a queer player in men's sport

image.altText: Sara holds her baby and smiles. The baby has a tube in her nose.

props.synopsis: After she started haemorrhaging at 22 weeks pregnant, Canberran Sara Batchelor and her daughter Rivah-Skye survived thanks to blood transfusions — and now the mother is urging Australians to roll up their sleeves.

title.children: Blood transfusions saved Rivah's life, but the type used is in short supply

image.altText: A young man in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old Korumburra man has been sentenced to nine and a half years in prison after killing 21-year-old Jake Bradford in January 2023 when he attacked, stripped, robbed and ran over his victim in a car.

title.children: Kayle Hansen sentenced to nine years for manslaughter of Jake Bradford

image.altText: A group of police in uniform stand beside a four wheel drive car on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: A court hears a grandmother charged with stabbing two family members in a roadside attack may have acted violently as a result of medication she was taking.

title.children: Lawyer suggests Ozempic use led grandmother to stab family members

image.altText: Barry Lawrence in a suit jacket participating in an interview.

props.synopsis: A West Australian man who was honoured last year with a prestigious award for excellence in child protection is charged with child sex offences.

title.children: Man awarded for excellence in child protection charged with child sex abuse

image.altText: Close up of man's hands holding crisp white shirt.

props.synopsis: Here's how to keep white clothing looking its best, and avoid adding to your collection of dull, lacklustre and greying whites.

title.children: How to return your once-white clothing to its former glory

image.altText: A white crystalline substance scattered across a surface.

props.synopsis: A Fijian judge has sentenced one man to life in prison and handed down other jail terms of up to 55 years after the country's largest-ever drugs trial.

title.children: Fijian court hands down toughest-ever drug sentences after $1.37bn meth haul
